1.text: My spirit shall be wasted, my days shall be shortened, and only the grave remaineth for me.

2.text: I have not sinned, and my eye abideth in bitterness.

3.text: Deliver me O Lord, and set me beside thee, and let any manâ€™s hand fight against me.

4.text: Thou hast set their heart far from understanding, therefore they shall not be exalted.

5.text: He promiseth a prey to his companions, and the eyes of his children shall fail.

6.text: He hath made me as it were a byword of the people, and I am an example before them.

7.text: My eye is dim through indignation, and my limbs are brought as it were to nothing.

8.text: The just shall be astonished at this, and the innocent shall be raised up against the hypocrite.

9.text: And the just man shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.

10.text: Wherefore be you all converted, and come, and I shall not find among you any wise man.

11.text: My days have passed away, my thoughts are dissipated, tormenting my heart.

12.text: They have turned night into day, and after darkness I hope for light again.

13.text: If I wait hell is my house, and I have made my bed in darkness.

14.text: If I have said to rottenness: Thou art my father; to worms, my mother and my sister.

15.text: Where is now then my expectation, and who considereth my patience?

16.text: All that I have shall go down into the deepest pit: thinkest thou that there at least I shall have rest?
